channel.title: Help With Some Nulls?
channel.description:
Ok so i made my server got every without a problem, made some commands, blah blah.
But i noticed yesterday that some vendors had an item considered "Null" which is easily known as nothing XD
but today i went to school and i didn't have the client uploaded anywhere i could get ahold of it so i used silabsoft for computer class and noticed that the items were now there, so my question how could i let the items become Unnulled i guess on my client so people can use them.
-Thanks!

item.title: Help With Some Nulls?
item.dc:creator: @snakefang snakefang
item.description:
@snakefang wrote:

[quote=“MasterofPK, post:7, topic:273852”]Lol, If you have the model of the nulled item added, Go into your class8.java in your client files and find the top word (“if ID == ####”) of the item your looking for, log back into your server and spawn that ID. Then change your item.cfg.

If you dont have it added then you will have to find the model/s, add it to your models folder in your client files, open class8.java just find one of the same sort, so if your trying to add a Barrows Phat, look for a Rune Phat (if your client has them) and copy the Whole Rune Phat thing… Probably easier the find a TuT on adding models or items.

Hope this helped.[/quote]

K i liked your first tut moar =P

K so i checkd around my Class8 file and the items ARE in there but still set as null.

But one thing my pickup command refuses to work no matter what i do keeps doing a invaild thing, not due to the id but due to the command i guess.

::pickup right?

Gonna try the adding models thingy.

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Some Nulls?
item.dc:creator: @MasterofPK MasterofPK
item.description:
@MasterofPK wrote:

Lol, If you have the model of the nulled item added, Go into your class8.java in your client files and find the top word (“if ID == ####”) of the item your looking for, log back into your server and spawn that ID. Then change your item.cfg.

If you dont have it added then you will have to find the model/s, add it to your models folder in your client files, open class8.java just find one of the same sort, so if your trying to add a Barrows Phat, look for a Rune Phat (if your client has them) and copy the Whole Rune Phat thing… Probably easier the find a TuT on adding models or items.

Hope this helped.

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Some Nulls?
item.dc:creator: @snakefang snakefang
item.description:
@snakefang wrote:

Ok well i can try what he said, so brb XD

Nope didn’t work, the item.cfg and shop.cfg are set to the same thing but are still null.

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Some Nulls?
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

nope hes wrong. item.cfg will only set the prices and bonuses, i don’t have a clue why your changing shops.cfg.

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Some Nulls?
item.dc:creator: @snakefang snakefang
item.description:
@snakefang wrote:

wwe4eva:

You need to change the item id in the shops.cfg to the ones that are on your client. Say it was possible to go on a 508 server on Mopar client. Most items would be nulls, as mopar client uses different id’s. Dragonfireshield on a 508 is 11283. On most mopar servers it is 2621.

Ok so if the items are in my item.cfg they SHOULD work correctly and not null? So put those ids in my shops.cfg… K i think i see.

Read full topic
